lead_paragraph: MOROFF--Libby, died suddenly in New York on February 17, 2016, at the age of 79, following emergency cardiac surgery. She was born June 26, 1936 in Reading, PA, the daughter of Ralph and Sadie Levinson. She graduated from her beloved Oakwood Friends School in Poughkeepsie and was President of its Board of Managers for the past several years. She earned her B.A. from Barnard College, and a Master's Degree in Economics from Columbia University. She devoted her adult life to furthering the principles of social justice and equality for all. Her long career as an activist included a stint as Executive Director of the New York State Democratic Committee in the 1980s, and Political Director in the Manhattan Borough President's Office following that. She is survived by her husband Saul Moroff, her daughters Margaret Moroff and Diane Moroff, her sister Ruth Preven, and her grandchildren Noah and Sadie Reuter, whom she loved dearly and who loved her in return. She had the love, respect, and admiration of all who knew her. Her family will be at home in their Manhattan apartment Friday and Saturday, February 19 and 20, from 6 to 9pm. Contributions in her memory may be made to Oakwood Friends School, 22 Spackenkill Road, Poughkeepsie, NY 12603. A memorial celebration of her life will be held at a later date. 1/3
